intro: Oxytropis tompudae, commonly known as the Tompudae locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a noxious weed in some regions.
